Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bac7(1-16) (Synthetic AMPs, N-terminal fragment of Bac7, Arg-rich, Pro-rich; PrAMPs, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (69.57%) toBac7(1-23)P: 38%; R: 50%. GRAVY: -2.33; M Wt: 2076.541; Mol formula: C90H162N40O17; mol ex coeff: 0.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 25922 or ML-35 (MIC 2 uM), S. enterica serovar Typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC 1 uM), S. marcescens ATCC8100 (MIC 8 uM), K. pneumoniae 13 clinical strains (MIC 1-16 uM), A. baumannii 12 clinical strains (MIC 0.5-64 uM), P. aeruginosa 20 clinical strains (MIC 64->128 uM), B.cepacia 10 clinical strains (MIC > 128 uM),  S.aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC >128 uM).Structure: Structure in complex with bacterial ribosome has been determined (Seefeldt et al., 2016). There is also a crystal structure of the substrate binding domain of E. coli DnaK in complex with bovine Bac7(1-16).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Literature Information.Author: Benincasa M, Scocchi M, Podda E, Skerlavaj B, Dolzani L, Gennaro R. 2004
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial activity of Bac7 fragments against drug-resistant clinical isolates
